glossdef.p: A pattern or identifier used to locate specific elements in a web page or application UI. Selectors can use CSS syntax, ARIA attributes, XPath, or text matching to target elements for test actions.
A validation statement that checks whether a specific condition or expected state is true during test execution. Assertions are critical for verifying application behavior and detecting defects.
An individual step or operation performed during test execution, such as navigating to a URL, clicking a button, typing text, or making an HTTP request.
The execution environment for tests, including the browser type, platform, viewport size, and other configuration settings that define how and where tests run.
A structured document (typically JSON or YAML) that defines test suites, test cases, steps, and configuration. The specification serves as the executable test definition.
